fields.physical_description:
This is a rather crude toy; hand carved and stained but not smoothed down. It is the stylized form of the horses and sleigh mounted on a flat base which in turn is on four wheels held to a static axle by nails. The horses are not painted but are decorated with lines of purple dots to show the bridles and manes; the yokes are stained turquoise. The tails are lengths of black felt glued on. The centre horse has the shafts (stained turquoise) and a harness (stained pink) nailed on to its body. The sleigh is stained yellow and decorated with turquoise pink and black around the top edge and on the side and bottom to show a floral design. Glued to the seat is a figure; very crude and stylized; stained yellow with turquoise on the arms and pink on the hands and hat. The facial features have been painted in black. From the figure's hands to the mouth of the centre horse is a length of black thread; representing the reins. The base is stained yellow and the wheels pink. All the parts are nailed on. 
This toy was made to traditional designs and it would have been sold to the Co-operative group for sale. Although the area co-operatives have been replaced there is still no credit given to an actual maker.
fields.title: Troika
fields.location: Museum of Childhood, Moving Toys Gallery, case 5
Museum of Childhood, Moving Toys Gallery

fields.name: Museum of Childhood, Moving Toys Gallery

fields.history_note:
References: RUSSIAN FOLK TOYS booklet published by the Museum of Toys; USSR Academy of Pedagogical Sciences. see also registered packet

Collection was presented to BGM by the Traditional Sergiev Cultures Centre; following an exhibition at the Cambridge Folk Museum; September 1994. The items are modern; made to the traditional designs and methods by craftsmen whose families had produced the toys before 1900.

Price: £25.00
fields.production_note:
Made in the village of Fedoseevo; in the region of Nizhni Novgorod; no known maker
Russia
